intro: Phyllostegia brevidens var. ambigua, commonly known as the narrow-leaved strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers with two-lipped petals. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both ecological and horticultural studies.
